meanings.definition: The art or practice of composing verse.
meanings.sent1: Her love for versification began when she wrote her first poem.
meanings.sent2: Studying different forms of versification helped improve her writing skills.
meanings.sent3: The competition for the best versification in the school magazine was fierce.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a canvas, and his words were the colors of versification.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of her versification left the audience in awe.

meanings.definition: The structure or form of verse.
meanings.sent1: The versification of the poem followed a strict rhyme scheme.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the versification of Shakespeare's sonnets can be challenging.
meanings.sent3: The teacher explained the importance of proper versification in poetry.
meanings.sent4: The versification of the song created a melodic flow of words.
meanings.sent5: His attention to detail in versification made his poems stand out.

meanings.definition: The act of turning prose into verse.
meanings.sent1: Her versification of the story added a poetic touch to the narrative.
meanings.sent2: The process of versification requires a deep understanding of both prose and poetry.
meanings.sent3: He attempted the versification of a famous speech with mixed results.
meanings.sent4: The versification of the novel transformed it into a lyrical masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: Through careful versification, he brought new life to old tales.
